file_content.text: I hope you can see the smile on my face, apprentice. You are turning me into a true believer.
That pleases me, master.
I'm glad.
Wait a minute, let me pinch myself.
I can't believe it.
Quit buttering me up. What now?
No time for a shine job.
I'm sure you're impatient to complete your time on that little rock.
With the satellite tower computer destroyed and Commander Rylon's son neutralized, my spy's tracks are covered.
Now, the only threat to Rylon ever being exposed is the man himself. It's time to end that threat. Permanently.
I'm going to wipe him off the face of this planet.
I'll savor the kill.
Ready and able, that's what makes you such a lethal and valuable asset.
I can do that.
Do I have a choice in the matter?
Must I?
I like that idleness makes you disagreeable.
Just be sure to give Commander Rylon an honorable death. It's the least we can do.
I've had him imbedded within enemy ranks for decades. The extent of his contribution to the Empire's interests is unrivaled.
The man is a hero. Pity he has to die.
Too bad.
He has always known the risk.
It's time to retire him. He served his purpose.
He's all used up.
You took the words right out of my mouth, apprentice.
I'll be sure to thank him before I kill him.
I don't care what he's done.
At your discretion, apprentice, but that won't be necessary.
The Jedi investigator must have no hard evidence that Rylon was killed to silence him.
It must look like anything but a targeted execution--annihilate everyone there.
No problem.
See to that.
Sounds like overkill to me.
Is that really necessary?
Your objection is noted. The order remains.
An apprentice's work is never done.
If I must.
Be glad of that. When I stop giving you work, you should be worried.
I've summoned Lieutenant Quinn. He'll prepare you for your final task.
Your final target is the Balmorran Arms Factory. The resistance forces recently captured it and made it their headquarters.
An incursion into the Arms Factory will be a monumental feat. I'm excited by the prospect of you laying waste to that place.
A Sith craves adventure and excitement.
My kind of work.
This mission promises both, my lord.
We're on the same page, Lieutenant.
As am I.
That will make us an unstoppable force, my lord.
So, I excite you, do I?
[Flirt] Nice choice of words.
W--well, what I meant was... when I imagine all the ways you will shape the galaxy, I get very excited, yes.
How easily you fluster, Lieutenant.
You're turning red.
Well, my lord, your question was a bit surprising. My mind is on the task at hand.
You're right, of course. No time for distraction. Proceed.
Yes, I'll stop wasting time.
It's called multitasking, Lieutenant. Look into it.
You need to diversify.
I am always interested in bettering myself, my lord.
Nothing should ever catch you by surprise.
Hope you're not easily thrown.
Very few things do, my lord. You seem to have a knack for it.
Try to remain professional, Lieutenant. Proceed with your briefing.
That's what I figured.
Admit it, you like me, don't you, Quinn?
You have a crush on me.
My lord, is this an appropriate time and place for such an inquiry? You're putting me in a--a very awkward position.
Perhaps you're right, Lieutenant. Proceed.
I see your point.
It was fun to see you squirm, but now I'm over it.
I enjoyed that.
Aren't your quarters an appropriate place?
This is a fine location.
Uh... I grant you that. It's not the place perhaps, but, uh, rather the time that leaves something to be desired.
I agree--time is of the essence. Proceed with your briefing.
You're right.
You need to learn how to loosen up, Lieutenant. A little spontaneity would do you good.
You're so conservative.
I--I'll look into acquiring some in the near future, my lord.
You're right, I wouldn't want to rush it.
We'll take our time, then.
N--no, nor... nor would I, my lord.
May I continue to brief you on the Balmorran Arms Factory?
By all means. I'll let you off the hook.
Relax, Lieutenant.
I appreciate your mercy and grace, my lord.
I reserve the right to readdress this issue in the future.
We can flirt more later.
That is your prerogative, of course.
Be sure you make it brief.
Quickly.
I will do my best, my lord.
Just spit out the details, Imperial. Try to contain yourself.
Get on with it.
Yes, my lord. I will not stray from the facts again.
All right. The Republic command center is deep inside the Arms Factory, the most heavily protected installation on the planet.
In order to reach Commander Rylon, you will have to make your way past all of the factory's defenses--which are considerable.
Give me a rundown on those defenses.
Tell me what I'm up against.
Unknown, my lord. But the resistance will certainly have state-of-the-art security and attack droids.
Makes no difference to me.
That's inconsequential.
I'm hard-pressed not to agree. But there is one thing you should note.
I like a challenge.
Stationed inside are an estimated one thousand of the Republic's best trained soldiers.
Specifically, Rylon's elite squadron is responsible for some of the most precise, improbable resistance victories on Balmorra. They're legendary.
They're practically dead.
Not for much longer.
Sounds like you admire them, Lieutenant.
High praise indeed.
I've marveled at their tactical exploits, that's all. It will be a bright day on Balmorra when they are eliminated.
I hate them already. I'll feed off that.
I'm feeling malicious.
The Empire's cause here on Balmorra will be greatly advanced once they're gone.
One final thing: The investigator that the Jedi sent has been concentrating her activity around the Arms Factory.
I have her under minute-by-minute surveillance. If she becomes a problem, I'll contact you on your comlink.
That will be fine.
I'm on top of it.
I'll answer if I feel like it.
You can try.
Do what you have to do, Imperial. But only bother me if it's dire.
Make yourself scarce.
I hope there will be no reason to disturb you.
I will be here to salute you when the Balmorran Arms Factory is a smoking husk, my lord.
Ah, you've arrived on Balmorra. Excellent. Your contact there is Lieutenant Malavai Quinn. I trust you'll find him most helpful.
I have no doubt, master.
I'm sure.
This is an important mission, and I only entrust the finest.
Where can I find this man?
Tell me where to go.
Must I endure lowly Imperials?
This is beneath me.
Don't let the low rank fool you. The lieutenant is an exceptional officer.
Quinn will meet you in his offices at Sobrik headquarters. We will speak again as soon as he has briefed you.
